Hi 

Refer to excel spreadsheet.

This is what the data looks like Columns =
B to F Is the Open High Low Close and 
Volume of our target Data, Column E =
is the Close prices this is what we are 
trying to forecast for the followi=
ng period. Column M to AP is the Astrological  
Data that would be used as =
inputs, Note the Astro engine can  Generate  data 
indefinitely into the fu=
ture, this can be helpful in our forecasts

I hope this is clear 
Thanks Re=
gardsPeter




________________________________
From: Peter Henry <blackpri=
nzze@...>
To: neat@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Wed, 3 November, 2010 1:31=
:05
Subject: Re: [neat] Fiancial trading with Hyperneat

  
Hello Wesley,

=
Thanks for your response. I'm doing it for fun interest and personal profit=
 if 
it works, I'm more fascinated by the prospect both Astro and AI workin=
g 
together. 


The Swiss Astro Engine is freely available and can generate=
 planetary 
information in real time. I would initially start with daily pr=
ice data then 
scale it up to Monthly or Hours and minutes. 


The inputs i=
s going to be the planetary locations together with the close prices 
of ta=
rget data. 


I have all the data available in excel format, what the best =
and quickest way to 
carry out some tests?


Peter   




_________________=
_______________
From: Wesley Tansey <tansey@...>
To: neat@...=
m
Sent: Wed, 3 November, 2010 1:01:02
Subject: Re: [neat] Fiancial trading =
with Hyperneat

  
Hi Peter,

Maybe you could fill us in a little more. For=
 starters, what's an Astro Engine? 
What kind of intervals are you trading?=
 What are the     inputs/outputs going  
to be? What is your data set size?=
 How are you     going to prevent 
over-fitting?

1. I think it's impossibl=
e to say without knowing more.
2. Not theoretically. I suppose at some poin=
t, your net gets too     slow to be 
practical.
3. The EPlex C++ framework:=
 
http://eplex.cs.ucf.edu/software.html#gaucij_HyperNEAT
Also, Colin Green'=
s SharpNEAT (C#) framework: 
https://sites.google.com/site/sharpneat/

Also=
, are you doing this for fun or profit? If you're doing it for     profit, =

there are a ton of other considerations that you have to     take into acc=
ount, 
particularly regarding trading costs and     regulations.

Wesley

O=
n 11/2/2010 8:47 PM, Peter Henry wrote: 
  
>Hello, 
>
>I would like to cre=
ate trading indicator and systems                 using 
>HyperNEAT, input =
data is going to be fed from an Astro Engine, up-to 30 inputs 
>required an=
d one output. 
>
>
>Can someone please answer the following questions or   =
              simply give 
>there options 
>
>
>1, Does anyone think the Hy=
perNEAT is suitable for such                 a task
>2, Is there any restri=
ctions on the amount of input data                 that 
>can be used. 
>
>=
3, What is the best HyperNEAT Software Libraries                  available=

>
>The engine is going to be used for forecast forex prices               =
  using 
>Astro and Inter-market data. HyperNeat to be used                =
 to work out 
>relationships and predict prices,
>
>Thanks in advance I wil=
l share any results with group 
>
>Peter 
>
>
